item.title: Optimization: Standard Form
item.description: Images in this posst came from the slides of CS524 at UW-Madison , 2023Spring This notebook runs in Julia and is rendered by Hupyter . The standard form of linear optimization problems is: $$ \begin{align*} \underset{x\in \mathbb{R}^n}{\text{maximize}}\qquad& c^{T} x\\ \text{subject to:}\qquad& Ax \le b\\ & x \ge 0 \end{align*} $$ Transformation tricks Conversion between min and max: $min f(x) = - max(-f(x))$ $Ax >= b$ <=> $-Ax <= -b$ $f(x) = 0$ <=> $f(x) >= 0$ and $f(x) <= 0$ $x \in \mathbb{R} <=> u \ge 0, v \ge 0, x = u - v$ An example $$ \begin{align*} \underset{p, q}{\text{minimize}}\qquad& p + q\\ \text{subject to:}\qquad& 5p - 3q = 7\\ & 2p + q \ge 2 \\ & 1 \le q \le 4 \end{align*} $$
